metadata.title: CVE-2023-47480 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue in Pure Data 0.54-0 and fixed in 0.54-1 allows a local attacker toescalate privileges via the set*id () function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-47480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpd0 - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-common - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-core - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-extra - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-gui - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-gui-l10n - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata-utils - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata64 - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
puredata64-core - 0.54.1+ds-4build3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: puredata package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.54.1+ds-4build3').
